action.action-desc: Mr. Rothfus (for himself and Mr. Higgins) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to prohibit the inclusion of social security numbers of donors in charitable contribution substantiation acknowledgements.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Charitable Giving Privacy Protection Act.

section.header: Prohibition on inclusion of social security numbers of donors in charitable contribution substantiation acknowledgements

subsection.text: Section 170(f)(8) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by redesignating subparagraph (E) as subparagraph (F) and by inserting after subparagraph (D) the following:

subparagraph.header: Prohibition on requiring or accepting collection of social security numbers

clause.text: For purposes of this paragraph, the Secretary may not require or accept social security numbers of donors from donee organizations.
The Secretary may require the use of an identifier other than a social security number for purposes of this paragraph.

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
